alfredsnippet.snippet:
"... Even some everyday materials can be described as plasmas because they show similarities to the free-electron plasma described above: the conduction electrons in metals and electron hole pairs in semiconductors are charges which can move quasi-freely and lead to a behavior of the matter which can be described in the same way as for a plasma.  The free-electron gas in metals is therefore also included as example of a plasma ..."

(Space Physics, at https://books.google.com/books?vid=ISBN3540206175&id=HnyPP4B4n-4C&pg=PA4&lpg=PA4&ots=JYLozZJ9Sq&dq=plasma+99+universe+date:2003-2007&num=50&sig=CsyG2Lat1MiND3usk1bMYyItd9Q#v=onepage&q&f=false)
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Plasma is 99% of Observable Matter - part 14
